title: JavaScript Certification Test (Domain 4 & 5)
instructions: You have only one chance to attempt this test. Once submitted, it cannot be retaken.

questions.text: A developer writes a function that may throw an error due to invalid input. They want to ensure that a cleanup message is logged regardless of whether an error occurs or not. Which block of JavaScript error handling guarantees execution in all cases?
In a JavaScript program, a function throws a custom error when division by zero is attempted. Which keyword is explicitly used to generate this error manually?
While debugging a program, a developer wants to identify the type of runtime error that occurs when accessing a variable that has not been declared. Which JavaScript error type will be generated?
Consider a try catch structure where JSON.parse is used on invalid JSON data. If parsing fails, which part of the structure handles the exception and prevents the program from crashing?
A developer wants to display a custom message when an invalid age value is entered. They use throw new Error with a message string. Which property of the Error object stores this message?
What will happen if a JavaScript exception is thrown but not handled using a try catch structure?
A developer wants to stop form submission if validation fails. Which method should be called inside the submit event handler to prevent default browser behavior?
While validating numeric input from a form, which JavaScript function is most appropriate to check whether the entered value is not a valid number?
A password comparison must be case insensitive. Which approach correctly ensures that Admin and admin are treated as equal values?
When validating text fields, why is the trim() method commonly used before comparison?
options: To remove extra spaces from both ends

questions.text: A developer chooses inline validation instead of alert messages. What is the main advantage of inline validation?

What is the primary purpose of client side input validation?

Which Browser Object Model object provides information about the user's browser such as name and version?
Which BOM method displays a dialog box with OK and Cancel options and returns a boolean value?
When using setTimeout in JavaScript, what is the main purpose of this function?
A developer wants to execute a function repeatedly after fixed intervals. Which function is most suitable?
Which object property provides the width of the user's screen in pixels?
What happens if an error is thrown inside the try block and there is no matching catch block?
Why is server side validation still required even if client side validation is implemented?
A developer compares two email fields after trimming spaces. What validation concept does this demonstrate?
Which JavaScript method converts user input into an integer for validation purposes?
A developer wants error handling without crashing the application. Which approach best fulfills this requirement?
Which Error object property helps developers debug by showing where the error occurred?
What is the main risk of relying only on alert based validation?
Which JavaScript feature allows graceful handling of unexpected runtime problems?
Why is it recommended to throw Error objects instead of plain strings?
options: Errors include stack trace and type
